description: The health care sector in the U.S. is undergoing rapid change that affects patients,
providers and payers. Managed care and managed competition are restructuring the delivery
of health care services and reducing costs, while frustrating physicians and patients.
The course examines the economic factors leading to the changes, current issues and
controversies, and federal health policies. Students interested in nursing, medicine, and
the sciences are encouraged to enroll.  Offered annually.  Also counts toward public health
studies concentration. Prerequisites: one of ECON 110-121
